snippet: Jonathan Ive, Apple's senior vice president of industrial design, has been named a Knight Commander of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire by Queen Elizabeth II for a long list of achievements in shaping the look of Apple products, incl...
abstract: Jonathan Ive, Apple's senior vice president of industrial design, has been named a Knight Commander of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire by Queen Elizabeth II for a long list of achievements in shaping the look of Apple products, including the iPhone, iPad and iPod.

headline.main: The iKnight: Apple's Jonathan Ive Gets British Honor

snippet: In Friday’s New York Times, Quentin Hardy reported on yet another chapter in the saga of Mark Hurd, the former ch...
abstract:
In Friday’s New York Times, Quentin Hardy reported on yet another chapter in the saga of Mark Hurd, the former chief executive of Hewlett-Packard. A Delaware court ruled Wednesday that the letter that led to Mr. Hurd’s resignation on Aug. 6, 2010, could be made public. The court did not release the letter yet, but the document was obtained by The Times from someone close to the case.

The letter was from a lawyer, Gloria Allred, to Mr. Hurd, and described his relationship with Jodie Fisher, accusing him of sexually harassing her. The letter set in motion internal investigations at the company that resulted in Mr. Hurd’s resignation.

Mr. Hurd fought to keep the letter private. And after Ms. Fisher settled her dispute with him, two days before his resignation, she said the letter contained many inaccuracies. Nonetheless, by offering a detailed chronology of Ms. Fisher’s view of her relationship with Mr. Hurd, the letter is getting a lot of attention. On Twitter, for example, Heidi N. Moore wrote, “Jodie Fisher letter makes Mark Hurd seem like a guy who seriously can’t take a hint.” And Michael Gartenberg wrote, “Dumbest tech event of the year? Killing Flip? Touchpad saga? Anything to do with Mark Hurd? Anything titled ‘Apple might...’ Go.”

headline.main: Daily Report: The Mark Hurd Saga Continues
